skill.name: ru
skill.description: Multi-repository synchronization tool with AI-assisted code review orchestration. Automates git operations across dozens of repositories with parallel sync, agent-sweep for uncommitted changes, and integration with Claude Code for automated commit generation.
skill.summary: Automate multi-repo synchronization and AI-powered code review at scale
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: Evaluated 221 static findings as false positives. This is a legitimate multi-repository synchronization and automation tool. Scanner flagged documentation examples, security feature implementations (file denylist patterns for secrets), and standard DevOps operations as threats. The skill implements security best practices including secret scanning, file denylists, and quality gates. No actual vulnerabilities found.

low_findings.title: Documentation Contains Installation Command with Pipe to Shell
low_findings.description: Line 481 shows installation command using curl pipe to bash. This is standard practice for CLI tool installation but users should verify source authenticity. This is documentation only, not executable code in the skill itself.

content.user_title: Synchronize Multiple GitHub Repositories with AI Review
content.value_statement: Managing dozens of GitHub repositories manually is time-consuming and error-prone. RU automates repository synchronization, orchestrates AI-powered code reviews, and processes uncommitted changes across your entire project portfolio using Claude Code.
actual_capabilities: Synchronize dozens or hundreds of GitHub repositories in parallel with configurable workers
Orchestrate AI-assisted code review across multiple repositories using Claude Code integration
Automatically process repositories with uncommitted changes using agent-sweep workflow
Generate structured commit messages using AI analysis of uncommitted work
Prioritize issues and pull requests using configurable scoring algorithms based on labels and age
Integrate with tmux and ntm for multi-agent workflow management and session orchestration
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI installed and authenticated with valid credentials
Only supports GitHub repositories, not other Git hosting providers
AI review and agent-sweep features require Claude Code to be available
Quality gate execution limited to supported project types with standard tooling

use_cases.title: Maintain Repository Hygiene at Scale
use_cases.description: Keep dozens of personal projects and forks synchronized without manual git pull commands. Detect stale branches and merge conflicts early before they accumulate into larger problems.

use_cases.title: Automate Code Review Workflows
use_cases.description: Schedule AI-powered code reviews across all repositories in your portfolio. Use priority scoring to focus on critical security issues and urgent pull requests first.

use_cases.title: Process Uncommitted Changes Automatically
use_cases.description: Let AI agents analyze, stage, and commit work-in-progress across all repositories with uncommitted changes. Optionally create releases with automatic version bumps based on commit history.

output: Run without --dry-run flag to execute the planned actions

best_practices: Always run ru sync with dry-run flag before actual synchronization to preview changes and avoid surprises
Configure secret scanning with block mode to prevent credential leaks and enforce security policies
Create per-repository configuration files for project-specific rules and custom workflows
anti_patterns: Avoid running ru sync without understanding the update strategy as different strategies handle diverged branches differently
Do not process repositories without first reviewing the file denylist to ensure secrets are not committed
Never interrupt agent-sweep sessions manually as this can leave repositories in inconsistent states

faq.question: What is the difference between ru sync and ru agent-sweep?
faq.answer: The ru sync command pulls upstream changes from remote repositories into local clones. The ru agent-sweep command processes uncommitted local changes and uses AI to analyze, stage, and create commits for work-in-progress.

faq.question: How does the secret denylist protect against credential leaks?
faq.answer: Files matching patterns like .env, *.pem, *.key, id_rsa*, and credentials.json are automatically blocked from commits regardless of what the AI agent proposes. This provides a security guardrail against accidental credential exposure.

faq.question: Can I use this tool without Claude Code installed?
faq.answer: Yes. The basic ru sync and ru status commands work without AI integration. Only the agent-sweep and review orchestration features require Claude Code to be available for AI-powered analysis.

faq.question: What update strategies are available for synchronization?
faq.answer: Three strategies are supported: ff-only (safest, fails if branches diverged), rebase (rebases local commits on top of remote), and merge (creates merge commits when needed).

faq.question: How does parallel processing improve performance?
faq.answer: Use the -j flag to specify parallel worker count. RU implements a work-stealing queue for efficient distribution of repository operations across multiple workers, significantly reducing total synchronization time.

faq.question: Where is configuration data stored?
faq.answer: Configuration follows XDG Base Directory specification: ~/.config/ru/ for configuration and repository lists, ~/.local/state/ru/ for logs and runtime state. This ensures clean separation and portability.
